data.title: Thai or Quasi-Thai?
data.text: We had been wanting to try this restaurant & finally gave it a go.  We ordered yellow chicken curry, shrimp pad thai, beef rad nar, and two Thai ice teas.  The only good thing about our food order were the Thai ice teas.  The food dishes did not taste Thai, rather they were a hint of Thai.  My husband is Thai & was quite upset at the restaurant's poor attempt to cook Thai food.

data.title: The food is great, but the TO GO SERVICES is HORRIBLE!!!
data.text: I been coming here for two years, the food itself is great and the waiters there is friendly when you there. If you are over the phone to order to go or pick up, my advise for you is don't even bother. The services is horrible, I got hung up twice and the third time all he said over the phone was yes, yes, yes and was rushing me. When I got my food it was wrong. I came from all the way from San Jose just for the food. I didn't go back to exchange my wrong order because I feel like it wasn't worth it. However these two photo I post up was my last time dining in there few months ago with my friend. YES, if you dine in, NO NO if order to pick up!

data.title: Like it for lunch
data.text:
We like to have there lunch. It is a small place with easy parking.
Service and cleanness is ok and we like the following:

Green Curry with beef
Eggplant - beef with stir-fried w/ eggplants, chili, garlic, & sweet basil

data.title: The best Thai food. Period!
data.text:
This is by far the best Thai food I ever have had. Not only in the bay area, but anywhere in US.

I love their Pad Kee Mao, Thai Basil Fried Rice and all of their curries, especially the Green Curry.

Me and my wife are so crazy about this place that we drive 25 miles on a weekday to have dinner there.

data.title: One of the best tasting Thai Cuisine in Fremont
data.text:
There was a time when I used to avoid Banh Thai due to the slack customer service. But I have noticed a change for the better over the past year. The food quality has become more consistent. These days I prefer Banh Thai to Sala Thai (another restaurant a couple of blocks away).

Satay Chicken and Tom Yum Chicken soup are my favorite. But their crispy garlic fish is simply mind blowing. It tastes best when served piping hot with their proprietary thick sweet and sour garlic sauce. Mango chicken is another great tasting dish I would recommend. 

Overall, food is delicious and I am a regular customer.

data.title: Good food if you only take-out. Service is crap
data.text: The food and portion size is very good. What they lack is customer service, even on a slack day. We got our appetizers and entrees but had to ask for spoon, then clarify that each of us (family of 3) needed a spoon. Repeat the same for fork, and then for paper napkin. In Banh Thai world, they seem to nickel and dime on things like paper napkin. Just one per person. After this last experience of dining in-house, I did not tip the cashier - he literally threw the receipt of credit card transaction at me.

data.title: Thai One On
data.text: Thai food is new to me but Banh Thai is pretty good. Made my second visit here earlier this week. We arrived before opening on a weeknight so had to wait a few. Once inside we were seated quickly. On this occasion there was four of us so we went family style with four dishes. The special of the night was choice one, Walnut Shrimp. This is a personal favorite and since I have it often am comfortable in saying they did it good justice. Our other dishes included the Green Curry, Pad Thai and Chicken Prik (?) which all were very tasty. The service is slow at times and we had to flag them down to get more water and the check. Overall I would say I am satisfied and am likely to return, though I do want to try other highly recommended Thai restaurants in the area.

data.title: Good Thai Cuisine
data.text: Banh Thai is one of my two favorite restaurants in Fremont. The crispy garlic fish is simply delicious! Specially when served hot and fresh! The magic sauce on the crispy fish is what gives it a great taste. The other two I would recommend are the black pepper chicken and the mango chicken. Would recommend this restaurant.

data.title: where did the flavor go?
data.text:
Used to be one of the good ones (though not the best one); but visited today and really had to ask where did the flavor go?
We ordered eggplant with shrimp; they gave us with chicken; though that was the only dish with flavor.
Tom kha, pumpkin curry really so so
Fried banana with ice cream was good though. Smaller portions compared to other places for dessert.
Will go to Sala Thai instead.

data.title: Pretty Good Thai
data.text: The menu at Bahn Thai had a few pleasant surprises. I had the pumpkin curry which was spicy, coconutty and pretty good. Also, a rice option was brown rice - sticky rice - which was also very good. We were the only non-asian/Indians in the place on a Saturday night, which is also a. Rey good sign.

data.title: Very good food
data.text: I've been here twice recently and not sure why it is rated lower than I would expect because both times it was been very good.  The food is very good.  The service is good and the decor is nice.  Not that pricy as a group of 5 of us just a week ago paid about $50+ tax/tip.

data.title: Decent Thai Food
data.text: Restaurant was clean and nicely appointed. The food was good but not outstanding. As Thai food goes, the majority of it was listed as hot and spicy. My husband ordered the Chicken Chow Mein, Chicken and Vegetables and I got the Pad Thai. The Pad Thai was very good. It was surprising that there were very few customers in there on a Sunday evening. Wait staff was friendly and efficient.

data.title: A great place for Thai cuisine in Fremont, CA
data.text:
Banh Thai restaurant is located in central Fremont opposite the Fremont Hub shopping center. You will find the food to be authentic and delicious. I would rate this among the top 5 Thai restaurants in the tri-city area of Fremont, Newark and Union City in terms of the food quality.
Ambiance - B+
Food - A-
Prices - B+
Service - B
The only con I would like to point out is that it can be a challenge if you would like to order food to go between 6-9 pm as they are always busy. Allow up to an hour wait. On a couple of occasions, the manager was too busy to take the order and requested I call later. Well they lost my business on those days.

data.title: good thai
data.text: We like Thai, so like most of the Thai restaurants anyway. But I like Milpitas Banh Thai more than Fremont one; better service.

data.title: We go there at least twice a month
data.text: Hands down the best Thai restaurant in Fremont. We NEVER felt disappointed with our food. Since we go there twice a month, we have tasted pretty much every single item on the menu. One can't go wrong with any of the dishes. The crowning jewels are the Tom Yum Goong soup, the spicy and crispy catfish curry and the sea food fried rice. Yummy!

data.title: Unauthentic and flavorless cuisine at high prices
data.text: Pad Thai $ 8.75:  oily, mushy, and very sweet.  Cat Fish Curry $ 12.25 : 3 fingers of fried catfish & 3 fingers of eggplant swimming in a thick & heavy curry coconut sauce.  Papaya salad $7.75 : old papaya, 3 tiny dried shrimps, half a green bean, 1/3 of a finger of tomato, half a lettuce leaf, in a diluted spicy fish sauce (nampla), on a small dish.  Steam rice: $1.50.  Portions were small.  Un-itemized bill presented on a tiny paper roll running out of ink, without name and address of the restaurant.  Receipt charged from credit card with space for tip and indication of tip 15%, 18% and 20% on top of the final amount which included tax.  Since when are we asked to pay tip on the tax ?  Owner / manager unpleasant.  IRS, have a look into this restaurant !

data.title: Good food, albeit a little on the sweeter side. Service is always courteous.
data.text: Good food, albeit a little on the sweeter side. Service is always courteous.

data.title: Food is OK, but their food, particularly their Pad Thai dish, tastes like old oil.
data.text: Food is OK, but their food, particularly their Pad Thai dish, tastes like old oil.

data.title: Good food and service
data.text: Food was good, but prices are a bit high.  The service was prompt.  My favorite dish was the stuffed chicken.  It was really good!
